page.title: 17Hall Engineering
page.content: Hall Engineering is a new firm. The machinery in use is designed by Mr. Hall himself, and is very modern. One is controlled by two computers. The firm manufactures elevator webs for harvesting vegetables. The elevator webs are made of rubber straps and steel bars. The steel bars start off as a coil of steel which weigh a ton. It is fed through rollers to iron out any kinks, and then put inside a furnace. A press guided by a magic eye shapes the bars. After cooling they are brittle and can be snapped off. The bars are heated up again to make them springy. Then rubber which is reinforced with cotton fibres has holes and grooves put in and it is attached with an automatic riveter to the bars. To finish it off it is dipped in tyre paint which dries in lO minutes. {Rachael Hindmarch
